paper_abstract: The problem of existence of an optimal-length (long) fault-free cycle in the n-dimensional hypercube with f faulty vertices is NP-hard. This holds even in case that f is bounded by a polynomial of degree three (six) with respect to n. On the other hand, there is a linear (quadratic) bound on f which guarantees that the problem is decidable in polynomial time. Similar results are obtained for paths as well as for paths between prescribed endvertices. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Computational complexity of long paths and cycles in faulty hypercubes
